Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alex j
Reviews.Content: Very old fashioned luxury hotel that sadly doesn't exist much in a world of corporate spa type hotels. Excellent service and large rooms (for Rome) with stunning marble bathrooms. Excellent value out of season if you shop around for prices. We found Travel Republic offered the best value. Worth upgrading the room to deluxe for the relatively small additional premium that it costs. Concierge gave excellent advice, particularly with local restaurants to visit. Breakfasts are also good but the hotel restaurant itself should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: A wonderful Art Deco hotel in a good central location. We stayed in a superb room, large and beautifully decorated. The main thing that stood out was the service. A doorman in morning dress, complete with top-hat, can sometimes be a sign of pretentiousness, but the staff were all delightfully friendly as well as attentive. One of the best hotels I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Old Dame”
Reviews.Author: al_sadr
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel in a perfect location Stunning service from arrival outside hotel until departure - service could not be faulted by someone who spends >100 nights a year in hotels. Lovely breakfast room and terrace with flawless service Super old fashioned bedrooms Beautiful public areas, lined with b/w photos documenting Rome's history (at least since invention of photography). Stunning bar Unhesitatingly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Very good.”
Reviews.Author: Lafontana R
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded due to noise from outside to room with balcony. They clean the rooms twice a day. Very very friendly staf.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, beautifully decorated & charming staff”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayers2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when we arrived in Italy. It was beautiful, old worldly but clean and with more modern touches. The room itself was gorgeous, we had our own terrace (junior suite) and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The breakfast included is the best we had in 4 weeks in Europe and the room it is served in is stunning! Hotel is located close to the Spanish steps and within walking distance of everything, however we took cabs at night. Hotel staff were wonderful and recommended fantastic local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: babs441
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with my stay at the Majestic. I am 19 and decided to do a little Eat, Pray, Love trip through Italy. It was my first time in Rome. I am EXTREMELY picky when it comes to hotels and cleanliness. The Majestic is AMAZING. It's so clean you could probably sleep on the floor. I stayed at a single room and it was super cozy. Free wi-fi in the rooms, comfy slippers, and delicious smelling shampoo. The towels were changed twice a day, toiletries were replaced twice a day. Turndown service is such a plus and the staff is incredibly accommodating. I arrived after a 15hr flight and asked about tours they were able to book me on a tour early the next day I was only in Rome for 5 days and wanted a head start. The Location is superb close to EVERYTHING. Walking distance to all the major sights. The breakfast is delicious and fresh. I wish there was a Majestic Hotel in every city in Italy. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: raymarks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights there in March. We stayed in a superior room (the cheapest) which was in need of refurbishment but was spotlessly clean. Moreover the bed was very comfortable - quite rare these days. All the staff were friendly, helpful and competent. The breakfast buffet was as good as any we have experienced. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic-a little bit of good life”
Reviews.Author: janiceLisbon
Reviews.Content: I could live there all days of my life. Staff is very friendly and polite. It is placed in a good place in Roma at Via Veneto. Easy to be in all the beautiful places of Rome. We have the feeling r are in the heart of a beautiful and unforgetable city. Rooms are very confortable and the white and red create a good atmosphere. The terasse is wonderful looks to come from a movie and it id great to eat there. Food are good and you have a right feeling of live well and to a fair price. I will stay there and it will be a pleasure to revisit Roma, always.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service, great location, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: wagger301
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Jan 2012. The people at the hotel went out of their way to know our names and take care of anything we needed. The concierge and even people just working the front desk gave wonderful restaurant recommendations. The rooms were beautifully decorated, as well as the whole hotel. Most of the sites were in walking distance, in addition to many wonderful restaurants. Would absolutely recommend it and will certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Essexlim
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is A* Rooms are fine size, clean and exactly what you want from a traditional 5* Italian hotel Location is perfect Staff are perfect Once again I'd go with the majority of reviews to form my own opinion Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “old world charm”
Reviews.Author: peely95
Reviews.Content: Recently enjoyed a couple of nights here . it is located in an excellent position on Vittorio Veneto and walking distance to The Spanish Steps and The Trevi Fountain .Rooms are nicely furnished with lovely extra large double beds . My only complaint would be the bathroom was rather small and i dont think in a 5 star hotel you should have to climb into the bath to close the blinds in the bathroom for a bit of privacy !! Loads of antique furniture and the dining room is really nice. It was a little too cold sit out on the balcony , but i would expect in a few more weeks it would lovely to sit out there and enjoy drinks / dining .

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: chocolategoddess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently returned from a 4 night/5 day stay at the Majestic, Rome. We thoroughly recommend it. Firstly, the location of the hotel is very good. We prefer to walk and used no public transport except a taxi to and from the airport. It took approximately 40 minutes from the hotel to the Vatican, 30 minutes to the Colosseum, 6 minutes to the Spanish Steps, 12 minutes to the Trevi Fountain. Obviously being winter the temperatures were suitable for brisk walking and we would probably have been a bit slower in high summer. The hotel itself is charming; think 5 star service rather than slick and high-tech. It's very comfortable, very smart and very well maintained. The staff were all so nice.The staff at breakfast were the best of all. They were efficient and noticed when you needed something almost instantly. Nothing was too much trouble. They were very, very good at their jobs. The food was also, of course, of the first order; an international style selection of everything you can imagine for breakfast. Our room was clean and comfortable. The decor was in good order. Our room was a standard double and perfectly large enough. The bed linen was changed daily. Everything in the room worked. There was a room safe, as you'd expect. The hair dryer was attached to the bathroom wall which I do not like at all because I have long hair and have an uncomfortable time drying it. There was no kettle/ tea tray, again as usual. Would I stay here again? Yes, without hesitation. Room tip: I would ask for a room away from the Via Veneto, which had far more traffic on it than I had expected. Light sleepers might be disturbed by the road noise. Taxi tip: the journey to Rome from the airport is set at 40 Euro by the Rome council. We confirmed this with the driver as we got into the taxi at the airport and had no problem upon arrival at the hotel. When it came to leave the hotel telephoned a taxi for us, we did not double check the fair and we soon noticed the driver had put his meter on instead. As we were on the way home we could nbot be bothered to argue, but paid the 75 Euros instead. We could have avoided this by talking to the driver before getting into the car.

Reviews.Title: “Have everything i appreciate”
Reviews.Author: Hilde J
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was exellent, especially cappucino, juice, fresh fruit and croissant Staff very friendly and helpful In the bar Simone served us delicious fresh snack with our drinks Rooms comfortable and very estetic Some noise from carbage/ trash outside our room at the pavenebt at night and early morning

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: martin1England
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. The hotel is very well located and has extremely professional and pleasant staff. The rooms are fine although not exceptional but it was the members of staff who made our stay very pleasant. The breakfasts are excellent and the bar was very welcoming. We arrived back late on the Saturday evening and a party was taking place for a bunch of teenagers in the adjacent room to the bar. The staff were very concerned that we were being inconvenienced by the noise from the party when having a night cap and insisted in offering us free drinks which while not required was very much appreciated! (The Italian teenagers were no trouble at all - too busy being stylish...)

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tennisplayer1
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four days in Rome with my son and daughter. We absolutely loved this hotel. The concierge gave us truly excellent recommendations for dinner and the front staff was exceptional. My son showed the front desk staff a list compiled by the Guardian (UK) of the 10 best pizza places in the city. We asked them which one they'd recommend. They answered "none" and then one of them, who was from Naples, gave us an amazing recommendation for a Neapolitan pizza place behind the Colosseum. They were friendly yet professional and so accomodating. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the stuff of dreams”
Reviews.Author: completerandomer
Reviews.Content: If like me you appreciate checking into a hotel and immediately being made to feel welcome and special this is the hotel for you. The Majestic hotel truly specialises in offering perfection. From the moment I checked in until the unfortunate moment when I felt comfortable, truly spoilt and well rested. Rooms are tastefully decorated, large and most importantly incredible comfortable with one of the softest beds I have experienced. Breakfast is an incredible affair, well presented and complete. You are always greeted by friendly staff which is always a nice touch. I really can't find anything to critique this hotel on bar the fact that it really sets such a high standard that any other hotel is sure to disappoint. I would have gladly paid double the amount I paid for the pure enjoyment I got from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Ftlaudfatty
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 cold, rainy and even snowy nights at the Majestic last week. While the weather outside was dreary and cold, the hotel, its amenities, services and staff were all warm, friendly, beyond helpful and extremely comfortable. We loved this hotel for its style, its location and its wondeful staff. The breakfasts (included) were really good, and we even had the buffet lunch on our snowy day. The food was great, but the price tag for lunch is high! A wonderful experience. We would surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic hotel, via veneto Rome”
Reviews.Author: RoseMcCauley
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, nice hotel. I think location is the best thing about this hotel.. Hotel is nice also. Nice room anf gorgeous bathroon. We had breakfast one day but preferred to eat outside and plenty of places nearby wher you can eat outside. Service is very different in this country. Had dinner one night at the very fancy restaurant with lovely view but service was terribly slow, I mean unbelievably slow. we were starving and fed up by the time dinner arrived. Verry disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FancyNancy5
Reviews.Content: Our family of five and our friends -- a family of 4 -- all stayed here the week of Christmas 2011. We were so pleased with the Hotel. Everyone felt well cared for, service was great, Concierge was outstanding and went above and beyond to assist us with our travels outside of Rome. The hotel is beautiful. A lovely mixture of and new. Great location. We would highly recommend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Porky-Borky
Reviews.Content: We have been to Rome several times and normally stay outside the centre. Ss this was our first winter visit we decided to stay centrally.The location is great. In the buzz of central Rome, but the shutters and curtains made sure we slept well. Front desk stafff are helpful and efficient - nothing too much trouble The room was a good size for Rome. They new it was our honeymoon and gave us their only room with a private veranda, where we sat and sipped the bubbly that they had so kindly put in our room. Breakfast was excellent. As it was out of season the bistro was closed, so breakfast was served in the restaurant, which was beautiful but a litltle narrow for a buffet breakfast (a very minor issue). Breakfast staff were friendly and efficient, and the coffee was top notch - even by Rome standards. Bar staff - friendly and efficient. Ready to chat if you wanted, but new when to leave us love-birds alone. Bar and restuarant food is exactly as advertised - marvelous Sicialian styled with a modern slant. The squid on a fennel and orange salad maybe the best I've ever had. Would I go again - absolutely (but I'll have to save up).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - very positive surprise”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Polo_73
Reviews.Content: While Italy is one of my favorite destinations for both business and leisure travel I - in general - do find an issue with the hotel quality in Italy. Even very famous hotels with high reputation can turn out to be quite dated and not up to international standards. Not the Majestic. This was a real positive surprise and it is a real great hotel. Both in terms of building/rooms/design and service. The moment we arrived we felt great, very welcome and highly comfortable. ** overall ambience ** The hotel is more than 100 years old and seemed to be recently renovated. It keeps the 'old time' atmosphere but with modern touches. There are nice salons on the first floor which are perfect for a pre-dinner drink. ** Service ** The service quality was exceptionally high and the staff seemed to enjoy working there. In particular the staff at reception, the doormen and at breakfast provided exceptional service quality. Always in a relaxed way with a good sense of humor. ** Room ** We stayed in Junior Suite which was very nice and we had a lot of space. Essentially it was a proper sized room with a very small "extra room" with provided space for a round table and some chairs. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was nice and large, however no separate shower stall and no separate toilette. The room was facing Via Veneto. While at some times there is quite a lot of traffic on Via Veneto we did not have any noise issue. ** Restaurant ** Breakfast is served at the restaurant in the first floor which is a fantastic designed dining room. In summer there is also a terrace overlooking Via Veneto. Unfortunately we were not able to eat there in the evening as the Filippo La Mantia Restaurant was closed for Christmas holidays. ** Location ** The hotel is located on Via Veneto close to Piazza Barberini. It is about a 10 to 15 minutes walk to the shopping areas around Piazza Spagna. Other main sights like the Forum Romanum or Piazza Navona are in (long) walking distance. *** Reasons to stay at this hotel *** - classic hotel, newly renovated - high service quality - welcoming and cosy atmosphere but still a hotel of proper size - nice rooms (at least the better room category) - in general good value for money *** Why you might want to consider alternative hotels *** - while the location is good, you might prefer a hotel with a view, or closer to certain locations We will definitely stay there again when we go next time to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “majestic was great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nazly b
Reviews.Content: Front dest, concierge were so helpful and polite. room were small but very clean. we got room with break fast included, and it was awesome. the high light of my day, was so delicious. so close to spanish step and fountain travi, just few min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: NYInternational
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Hotel Majestic in Rome. We have never encountered in all of our years a friendlier, more helpful, or more professional staff in any other hotel. We tossed our books and relied on them entirely for recommendations for restaurants, etc. We found the front desk/concierge personnel were exceptional in their professionalism and their friendliness--special mentions to Claudio who immediately understood our wants and needs, Corinna who could not have been more helpful, and of course Faisal who treated us as if we were part of his family. Even the wait staff like Paolo and virtually everyone else could not have made our stay more pleasant or gone out of their way to make sure that we were happy We were not disappointed in anything. To say that the hotel is convenienty located is an understatement. This is an older, absolutely charming hotel that has retained all of its elegance. If you are looking for glitz and glass elevators, this is not the place. But for real old-world, well maintained elegance, this is for you. Everyone on the staff was remarkable, which is a real tribute to the management. They made us feel like guests in their home.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Rakipova
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff, amazing experience, 100% attentiveness from every member of the hotel team! Beautiful rooms and perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service”
Reviews.Author: CASPNSKI P
Reviews.Content: Love the location! Steps away from the "Steps" Was fortunate to be visiting while a Kimbo Coffee promotion was running in the bar area - delicious treat! My room was over looking the famous Via Veneto and featured a lovely balcony with table and chairs - perfect for breakfast or a night cap. Outstanding buffet breakfast and lunch in the main dining room, offering an abundance of options, beautifully displayed. Most memorable was the staff and service received during my visit. Extremely warm and welcoming from check-in to check-out. I travel to Rome often and this was the time that I felt most at home. See you soon for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Walter M
Reviews.Content: Begining of Dec. 2011 my wife and my self stayed at the Hotel Majestic Rome and we had really good time there and enjoyed staying in that Hotel. The Hotel itself is great as well as the physical location. A big surprise for my wife was that the Hotel recognized her birthday (our main reason for going to Rome) and she was very pleased for the greeting card and the bottle of Champagne the Hotel Management left in the room. All over all, great and warm hospitality from the Hotel Management and their staffs. Walter Mundt-Blum

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: njpicot
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 day trip to Rome and stayed at this hotel. We have traveled a lot and this is definetly one of the luxury "boutique" hotels of the world. Yes, it is expensive, but we had a great vacation, so it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Maimeo
Reviews.Content: Elegantly decorated and spotlessly clean, we rested here in luxury after a hectic day of touring. Staff was very helpful. One block from the Piazza Venezia where you can catch a number of "hop-on/hop off" buses to tour the city or catch the subway to St. Peter's and The Vatican. The Hotel is also a short walk to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish steps are nearby. We had a room with three single beds and there was ample space for the three of us. The bathroom is all marble and has a huge soaking tub with shower. The only reason I give this four rather than five stars is because the morning staff couldn't keep the breakfast buffet tables stocked for what appeared to be a full house in early October. The breakfast was very good, however, with scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage and bacon, fresh fruits and juices, pastries and breads and cheese trays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: freqnttravel
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Majestic. The location is fantastic, only a 3 min walk from the Spanish Steps. The room standard is good for Rome. However like practically all hotels in Rome, they turn their AC cooling off during the winter months. If you have a room facing the street, where the noise will prevent you from sleeping with an open window, you might find the room quite hot during the night. Staff is absolutely fantastic. Extremely friendly and keen to assist. All in all the best hotel I have tried in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Majestic Roma”
Reviews.Author: hanne13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our 3 night stay at Majestic Roma. I should say that we arrived here after a 3 night stay at JK Place in Florence, which was amazing, so my expectations were very high. Our room was spacious and clean, looking out on Via Venetto. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and well maintained. The location is great--we walked to the spanish steps, pantheon, trevi fountain, even ancient rome area (which is a bit of a hike, but lovely). Really, the only place you need to take a taxi is the vatican. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our one issue was when the front desk told us it would take 2 minutes for the doorman to get us a taxi to the Vatican and it ended up taking 35 minutes. If we had not booked a private tour (the woman waited for us) we would have missed it. The breakfast in the morning was wonderful. Overall, a lovely hotel that I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: davidjhammer
Reviews.Content: Nestled on Via Veneto, this hotel is a amazing spot for a Rome retreat. The Spanish Steps are right behind this hotel, Trevi Fountain just a 5 minute walk, and the Vatican, Colloseum and Palatino are just a 5 minute taxi ride away. Bernini Fountains can be found on every street intersection surrounding this hotel. I highly recommend this place and I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service & beautiful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: llp711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of Oct for 8 days. It was such a wonderful experience! We were on the 3rd floor & overlooked the street behind the hotel. No complaints here - the staff at the hotel is top-notch. They made a point of getting to know us & even sent up a bottle of champagne for my bday. Our hotel room was gorgeous & the location of the hotel is fantastic. Only a few minutes walk to the Fountain of Trevi or The Spanish Steps and all the fancy shops. There are plenty of great restaurant choices within a few blocks as well. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was amazing & eating out on the terrace was an added bonus. Although the dining room was equally as nice. I would highly recommend staying here. I felt as though we had found a little gem! Between the attentive staff & the luxurious accomodations, you will feel like a star! Enjoy-

Reviews.Title: “Really classy classic Roman hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andyonhishols
Reviews.Content: Sayed here for 2 nights on business. Location is great just up the hill from Trevino. my room was gorgeous. Desk staff were very polite and helpful. Not cheap but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “just terrible....not even 3*”
Reviews.Author: asiatraveller01
Reviews.Content: . I stayed here last week. Our room (424) badly needs refurbished - the toilet leaks, the shower dribbles, and the bath took 20 minutes to fill. In addition it is above the hotel bins - so you can hear staff throwing bottles into the bins at all hours. Plus you can hear the lift grinding up and down all night. On the first night we were told BOTH restaurants were not open to hotel guests as there were private functions. The restaurant manager (downstairs) was so rude it was laughable. The whole place needs refurbished. Staff at front desk were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Super spot in the middle of history”
Reviews.Author: CisMalle_belgium
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a couple of times. They maintain their high level service even with introducing younger staff. Rooms are great although smaller that one might expect from such hotel. We're not complaining since Rome is not a city to stay in your room all day. When something is not working properly, they react swiftly and solve it correctly (e.g. sputtering toilet, airco that could not be shut of). Great breakfast that you can enjoy on the terras. Excellent location in the nothern part of the old city. All in all a hotel to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia91360
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel and it was fabulous. Very courteous staff, wonderful, comfortable room. Great breakfast, up on the terrace, really good location to all of the attractions and within walking distance to many. Never a problem getting a taxi etc. Really, really nice stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WStravel11
Reviews.Content: This hotel on the Via Veneto is a charming and welcoming reasonably well appointed property. The staff are very helpful and efficient. Our first room on the first floor was a little disappointing. The hotel was going through renovations and the usual hiccups and upsets were being handled very well by the reception staff. We mentioned our disappointment regarding our room and we were transferred before we could even blink. Our next room on the 3rd floor was much better, slightly larger with a great street view. We were not charged any extra and could not complain about how staff had treated us. There were a few travellers having complaints about air-conditioning but eventually all problems seemed to be sorted out with a minimum of fuss. Breakfast is either inside the hotel or outside on a very cute little verandah facing the tree lined Via Veneto. The food however, is not too much to rave about. The buffet does not give you too much to choose from. A little hint, don't eat the bread rolls!!! Each morning we receiving a lovely basket of bread rolls but they looked better than they tasted. They were never fresh and extremely hard!!! This hotel is very close to the Spanish Steps and a short walk to the Fountain of Trevi. As you exit the hotel, to your left is the Hard Rock Cafe and to your right are many different restaurants that line the Via Veneto. Very handy and plenty to choose from. Would stay at this hotel again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not Five Star”
Reviews.Author: bartab59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near major transportation and a short walk to the Spanish Steps.The Staff is helpfull.The breakfast was ample.The AC was not working properly.This was a time the the temperatures in Rome were near 100 degrees.Management said it was the extreme heat.Well I stayed in hotels in Madrid where the temperatures are over 100 in August and the AC worked fine.The furniture in our room was worn and uncomfortable .The carpet was also worn.This is not what you accept from a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Rome”
Reviews.Author: VJM0085
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights in this luxurious and comfortable hotel in Rome just blocks from the Piazza Bernini and the American Embassy. The staff was fabulous. They were very courteous, always smiling and willing to be of service. The air conditioning worked well -- which says a a lot for hotels in Italy. The room was well decorated but one small issue was that our room was a little small. The end of the bed was very close to the desk/dresser so two people can not cross from one side of the room to the other at the same time. Breakfast was a buffet in a very elegant setting or you can sit outside which is a few floors up and overlook the main street. Service was also very efficient. I would stay here again if I ever returned to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and very clean - unfortunately a very small room”
Reviews.Author: CPS200
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending 3 nights at the Majestic. It was 100 degrees in Rome and the air conditioning in the hotel worked fine.(I noticed another reviewer had issues with the AC my room was comfortable). The location is perfect - the hotel is near everything and transportation (barbarini station 150yards away). The service behind the desk and in the dining room is understated and elegant. (I don't know who does the hiring but everyone who works here looks like they could be an Italian movie star - they are a nice looking group of people). My room was extremely clean and housekeeping came twice a day - really exceptional care was taken on the upkeep of the room very professional. The breakfast buffet with seating out on the terrace is lovely. The only issue that I had with the Majestic was the size of the room. I reserved a deluxe double and got a very small room. It was a disappointment. When I stay at these older properties in Italy I try to get Deluxe rooms over superior because they usually offer more space. I can't imaging what the smaller rooms look like in this place. I have stayed in deluxe rooms down the block at the Bernini and they were much larger although i think the service is better here. I will be back and just more careful booking rooms next time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most extraordinary hotels in eth world”
Reviews.Author: Christopher R
Reviews.Content: Our recent four night stay at the Hotel Majestic was one of the best hotel stays we have ever experienced. For starters, the properties' location on Via Vittoria Venuto, which is adjacent to the Spanish steps, is wonderful. The hotel's physical plant with a large first floor sitting room and warm wood paneling together with art deco fixtures add to the hotel's allure. You feel that you are stepping back into a movie set. In fact, many celebrities stay at the Hotel Majestic and; their signed photgraphs in the downstairs restaurant attest to the hotel's allure. The rooms are large and immaculate, Finally, the hotel's service is impeccable with a well trained and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A full 5 stars in the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: AV_Italy
Reviews.Content: I've been in Majestic Hotel in Rome in June 2011 for travel,I had a double room even if I was alone. Unfortunately I've been there only for one night but my room was the best I've seen of all hotels in via Veneto I've been in Rome. My room was really spatious and the bathroom was big,all was really luxurious. Moreover the terrace was really quiet with a wonderful view on via Veneto,a portion of piazza Barberini and all the rest of Rome's downtown. It's not a cheap hotel,but the required price is fair if compared to other hotels in the same zone of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: concepcion150782
Reviews.Content: The facility is outstanding: the rooms are big and clean. The staff is great. My deep gratitude to the lovely Francesca who always helped us with great advices during our stay and cared about all our needs. There is a catholic church just in front of the Hotel, and there are outstanding restaurants in walking distance. I really enjoyed the hotel and indeed I WILL BE BACK. I hihgly recommend this hotel for an unforgettable stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We just love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: We do love the Majestic because of 1.) the modern/classic style 2.) the location and especially the location of the breakfast (outside) 3.) Faisel, the Concierge For us there's nothing better when in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Glorious”
Reviews.Author: granddamme
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the essence of old world glamour in the heart of downtown Rome on Via Veneto. We stay here each time we visit Rome once per year because of its proximity to basically all areas within Rome such as restaurants, shops, galleries, monuments museums, Trevi Fountain and the hub bub of Rome. We love sitting on Via Veneto at the end of the day drinking our cocktails before freshing up for dinner. Hotel is plush, rooms are very luxurious and large.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marielaleong
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is perfect, walking distance to everything and steps away from a metro station. Beautiful hotel with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, extremely friendly, well-located”
Reviews.Author: tripadfan64
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3-day stay at Hotel Majestic in Rome, and I could not be happier with my choice. When I arrived the staff at the front desk greeted me like I was a favorite relative who rarely comes to visit. Everyone I spoke with, from doormen to porters to waiters to telephone operators could not have been any nicer, with one small exception (more on that later).The hotel is beautifully architected and enjoys one of the prime locations for sightseeing in Rome. I walked easily to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Parthenon, and the Coliseum/Roman Forum. Only the Vatican was a bit too far for me, although someone with younger and more energetic legs could manage it. In any case, St Peter's is a10E cab ride away. The room had lovely amenities such as wooden shutters on the large windows to keep out the street noise, marble in the bath, his and her dressers in the large closet (it was the first time in years that a hotel provided enough hangers to accommodate my travel wardrobe), huge thick curtains, and beautiful (silk?) rug. The air conditioning worked just fine in my room, though it was not overly hot outside in May. I have only 3 minor complaints, all technical in nature.The clock on the nightstand is plugged into an outlet that only works when the room light is on, so it is pretty useless. Alternatively, there is a clock in the TV, as i was informed when I called to complain about the clock, but the display is dimmed whenever the TV is off, so again, there is no way to easily see the time if one wakes up in the middle of the night, as I sometimes do. My second issue is that although the hotel provides wireless internet access for free (another bonus!), they do this by running about 8 different networks and encouraging guests to roam around until they find a working one. Depending on the location of your room and time of day, some work better than others. I was never able to get a connection with less than 5 tries, more often it was closer to 10, and the same one never worked twice in a row. I never failed to get a connection eventually though. Finally, the computers they have in the business center are a bit antiquated. I merely needed to print out a file that I had brought with me on a USB flash drive. One of the two computer had no USB slots, and the other had a slot but did not recognize my drive when I plugged it in. The front desk graciously called a technician to help me, and he arrived quickly, but spoke no English (I speak no Italian). As it was 9:30 or so in the evening, perhaps he is not the primary person to cover computer issues, and I got the impression that he was anxious to be done with me and my problem. We gave up without getting the printout, and I solved it myself later in a different way. I think things might have gone better if we had had a translator, so I will not judge too harshly based on that one incident. The daily breakfast buffet is quite nice, and restaurant is decent for dinner, but the menu is not as exceptional as everything else about the hotel. Overall I really enjoyed my stay here, and loot forward to returning soon. I recommend it particularly for those interested in a very safe, very convenient location, with a staff that goes out of their way to ensure foreigners enjoy their visits to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Rome, Italy!”
Reviews.Author: CtUSAMom
Reviews.Content: We were on a tour of Italy and arrived at The Hotel Majestic Roma. It turned out this hotel became our favorite. We were greeted by a very attentive staff even though we were part of a large tour group. The rooms were spacious, bright, and spotless! We had everything we needed in our rooms. We looked out on to the streets of Rome and enjoyed the view.

Reviews.Title: “The most effective escape from reality.”
Reviews.Author: Vincent019
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic for more than one month. You need concierge Faisal and his team to help you through the best Rome has to offer. It's as simple as that. Faisal knows everything and everyone. And he's like this old fashioned hospitality character from this bygone era when people actually knew what lifestyle and charisma mean. Plus, try the restaurant upstairs: it's tops my charts of awesome dining experience in the capital.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRWOLF2112
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel using the trip advisor reviews. We were not disappointed arrived early evening to a very warm welcome and an instant upgrade. The receptionist gave us plenty of information and the porter was very helpful. The room looked out onto the main road and was lavish and very clean. Even though we were on a busy road with the windows closed there was no traffic noise. Our upgrade included breakfast which was self service continental and a few hot items again the staff could not be more helpful. Though not cheap I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: whataglobetraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic last month with my wife. We are frequent travellers and we often pick Leading Hotels properties. We love the small size of the hotel which gives you that slow pace one needs during a vacation. The room we were give was very well appointed, wooden floor, white furniture and that italian style which is always the one we prefer. The staff was attentive and experienced especially front desk and breakfast. We had dinner in-house one night and we were not so satisfied with that. We will definetely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not good.”
Reviews.Author: ヒサボン
Reviews.Content: Not convienience location,safty box not fixed (It's easy to move!).Difficurt to get tax.Wireless internet can't connect!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant athmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Corazon123
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Majestic. Beautifull hotel , superb breakfast room. Nice service. You feel that you are in a 5*. 82euros for the service limo between airport and hotel, but the chauffeur was late ! Room is not so big but elegant. White. Lot of mirror. Free wifi in room. Superb bathroom in marble. Definitely a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and stylish”
Reviews.Author: hustlelancaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in mid February. Check - in was fun, they said they had upgraded us and so we could choose from 3 rooms. We then wandered from room to room in order to decide. It was quite comical but also charming to be racing around the hotel looking at rooms. In the end the room we settled on was lovely, staff were charming and breakfast was good. Concierge was efficient, I emailed them before we arrived for suggestions on restaurants and they replied fairly prompt. Beds were comfy. I can't really fault the hotel (except the bar wasn't always open in the day), and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Relaxaholic100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for everything. Location, food, Cleanliness and staff. Open top bus stops a few buildings away and metro is 50mtr. Only down - A bit expensive. If you keep and eye on booking.com the price goes up and down.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bones, Slightly Dated”
Reviews.Author: Andalu
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay the the Hotel Majestic, and did not find the ambiance overly formal (as another reviewer noted). There were actually many families there when we visited around the holidays. The building is wonderful and historic, and it's located in a very walkable part of Rome, and less than a block from the metro. Our room was a decent size for a European city, but as others pointed out, the decor needs some updating. The very white furniture and the very red curtains were a bit much, and the bathroom could use a redesign for sure. (It was totally fine, but not top notch) The breakfast room was really lovely, and service there was good. We found the front desk to be friendly and fairly helpful. Overall, we may not rush back, but we did enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and elegant hotel with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: KostakisG
Reviews.Content: It's been some time since I visited Rome and the Majestic but I cannot miss the pleasure of reviewing the hotel. This is certainly a historic hotel and I'm sure a very long time ago during the Belle Epoque era it was the place to be at Rome and the epitome of style and luxury. Now things are a bit different. The hotel tries to retain the Art Nouveau feeling especially in the mirrored small lobby next to the reception area with beautiful emerald green sofas and armchairs and some of the wooden antiques and porcelain vases are truly magnificent and may be regarded as museum quality pieces. The only one elevator is tiny and ancient but blends harmonically with the whole place. The communal reception areas on the first floor are wonderful with beautiful chandelliers, rich fabrics and an atmosphere of a bygone era. It's a pity that they are not located on the ground floor and serving as the main lobby of the hotel. My room was a single, which in other words means tiny, with no views at all except for a stone and brick wall. Nevertheless it was comfortable and tastefully decorated with dark blue and yellow striped drapes, a queen bed with quality linen and a nice clean carpet. The bathroom was white marble (Carrara?) with a big tub and quite spacious compared to the rest of the room. It's a shame that the toiletries provided were very basic and cheap quality. In addition, the flush of the toilet kept running all night long making a very disturbing noise. I imagine that there are much more beautiful rooms at the Majestic but this is clearly a case where you get exactly what you pay for. This is hotel past its prime but still stylish and maybe elegant. I noticed that the guests were mainly old, whispering to each other with a formal attitude which makes the place an absolutely no-no for young couples or even families. The staff at the reception and the bar were professional and moderately polite. There was a general sense of discomfort when circulating within the premises, feeling a bit stiff and formal all the times while thinking that Rome is generally a fun city and the people are mostly carefree and open hearted. I think the hotel obviously tries to keep the usual tourists away and this may be an advantage since you cannot help but notice awful touristy types at other five-star establishments like the Excelsior, also on the same street. In conclusion, I strongly believe that this is a matter of taste. If you like the austere atmosphere and a small taste of early 20th century history this is your place. If you plan to exlore Rome backpacking in shorts, vests and inappropriate jeans start looking elsewhere otherwise you'll be very disappointed and probably dismissed. And last but not least, stay here only if money is not the matter and if your pension pays well.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service of any hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: 01Guy
Reviews.Content: The good parts: To give the building itself justice, it is especially beautiful and historical although other aspects warrant a terrible rating. The rooms themselves are lavishly attired, albeit they lack the balance of modern and 'old world' so to speak, and the water comes out red from the taps due to a lack of maintenance on the pipes and long term rust corrosion, this could be harmful if swallowed. The restaurant is reasonable, with a good selection, but is overpriced. The bad parts: What lets this hotel down is the absolutely shockingly terrible service, incredibly rude staff, to the extent that they can only be described as appalling and abysmal. The real test for a hotel's hospitality is how they treat you when you are unwell, and the staff at this hotel basically will allow you to collapse and die rather than give you a human response and call a doctor. When you complain, and ask to speak to the manager, in the same way that the staff are no doubt trained to communicate with you, the manager proceeds to talk and shout over you and treat you like he is doing you a favour in the process Overall, stay away from this place and don't touch it with a barge pole. Overpriced, run down, disgusting service and there are far superior places to stay in Rome, such as the Intercontinental near the Spanish steps which knocks this place out of the water by miles.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Restaurant Worth the Room”
Reviews.Author: DLbovinecity
Reviews.Content: After too many business trips to Rome to count, my wife and I decided to visit for the 4th of July weekend solely for shopping and dining. I normally use other 5 star hotels on the Via Veneto but decided to try the Majestic for something different. We were surprised to find it had one of the most creative restaurants in the city and dining on the terrace overlooking the Via Veneto for breakfast and dinner is a unique experience. The staff was extremely helpful, obtaining not always easy to secure reservations in our favorite restaurants; and our room, although small, was a welcome refuge in the afternoon Roman summer heat . The lcoation is within walking distance of the Villa Borghese, Spanish Steps and shopping. I would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Very old but gold”
Reviews.Author: AHMED81
Reviews.Content: the hotel was really old for the 18th century, but the rooms were really elegant. also the bathrooms were LUX and new. the only thing was the resturant i feel it can look better. over all the location was crazy and the history of the hotel was great. may be it is expensive but it is a landmark.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect small luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: frequently_away
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on good recommendations and a favorable rate, compared to many five star hotels, especially the international chains. The hotel itself was in excellent shape, with highly functional rooms and baths. Rooms included safes and free WI-FI., which was especially appreciated with our dependence on our iTouch. The hotel staff was very friendly and responsive. For example, we arrived at 7:30 am and they got a room within an hour and a half, with cappuccinos while we waited. The only quibble was the bed, which was too firm for my spouse's back. Like most European hotels, the breakfast was very expensive (20-30 euros), so buy elsewhere or negotiate it into the base rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: eatdrinklaugh
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our room very much though we spent very little time there. Our room was very quiet and that's one huge plus for light sleepers. Great location to walk around or hop on the Metro. We're not big breakfast eaters just coffee, juice and fruit for us, no complaints there from us. Had dinner outdoors and it was a very good experience. The only thing I would have done differently in Rome would have been to more thoroughly researched restaurants as we found that the meals were really hit or miss.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zin827
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and we had excellent sevice and great meals.

Reviews.Title: “A Tiny Bit Tired Looking Now”
Reviews.Author: JackieBLondon
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a second stay at the Majestic. The staff were wonderful, as before, certainly at reception and a special thanks to Lorenzo in the bar! By contrast, I did notice however that, as the last time, the staff at breakfast are not very helpful or friendly. Also the dining room where breakfast is served, I noticed that the carpet needed a good vacuum and the sofa my friend had to sit on was covered in crumbs. The waiter just watched her as she brushed them all off without offering to help in any way or re-seat us. During our first stay a couple of years ago, we had a lovely room on the second floor but this time, we were on the first floor and the carpets in the hallway looked grubby and tired. After bigging the hotel up to my friend, I did feel a bit disappointed and a bit embarrassed. I am planning to return to Rome next year and would dearly love to stay at the Majestic for a third time - but can't help feeling they need to spruce things up a bit...and work on the attitude of their breakfast staff too. Otherwise, it is a lovely hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EastSussexWalker
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this Hotel nothing was to much trouble, the welcome we received was warm, friendly and efficient. All the staff at this hotel were polite friendly and very professional. Our double room was quite spacious and very clean, the bed was very comfortable. We stayed 5 nights and after walking and seeing the wonderful sights of Rome it was heaven to go back to!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “amazed”
Reviews.Author: Juergenwieser
Reviews.Content: the MAJESTIC is perfect located on via veneto, close sightseeing places and metro friendly staff - made a nice birthday surprise without announcing from my side. nice old fashioned furnished maybe a little to cold air conditioned (american guests probably like it) breakfast buffet simple but ok- nice terrace

Reviews.Title: “Another treasure of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Faemuzzy
Reviews.Content: After a 10 day cruise, we chose to stay here with friends of ours and being the ones to recommend, I researched Trip Advisor for about a week in January before choosing this hotel. We were so proud of ourselves when we arrived. On my husband's birthday, a bottle of champagne was in an ice bucket, two glasses beside, and a card "With Compliments of the Hotel." Wow! Would stay here again and again on our return...quiet & courteous. Many thanks to Corinne at reception for helping us with everything.

Reviews.Title: “This is an exellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbny_10
Reviews.Content: Eight friends and I stayed at this hotel in mid- to late-September 2010. But for one room among four that was somewhat substandard*, for a 5-star hotel that is also a member of the Leading Hotels of the World, we were extremely pleased with all aspects of it: = the professionalism and friendliness of the staff throughout the hotel = the unique, very stylish decor = the location = the quality/strength of the air conditioning in the rooms = the excellent daily breakfast that was included with our rate (excellent, varied selection of hot and cold foods to choose from) In sum, it was an excellent 5-star experience and we would stay there again. I highly recommend it. *The hotel moved my friends to another room, with apologies, when they pointed out the problems with the room (having to with cracked mirrors and torn carpeting).

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a decent value for the hotel class”
Reviews.Author: Edgingin
Reviews.Content: Things I liked about this hotel: Good rate on a very large Jr. Suite Charming older hotel which has been renovated The desk clerk (name begins with a C - totally escaping me right now) who was lovely and helpful when the concierge was not. Location was quiet but convenient Terrace where breakfast was served is beautiful Dislikes: The sitting area furniture in our room needs updating. It's tired and spotted. The concierge was not at all helpful. I asked for a specific restaurant recommendation and was told I should just go over to a particular neighborhood and eat anywhere. When I pressed for a specific name (really what I wanted was a reservation at a "nice" restaurant) it took the clerk stepping in for me to get a straight answer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: jjkreading
Reviews.Content: A long weekend in Rome was my wife's birthday present. I booked the Majestic through Thomas Cook and the only downside was that I ordered a shuttle from the Airport to the Majestic as part of the booking. The firm operating the shuttle was awful and it took ages to get a shuttle to the hotel - I will book a car next time. The Majestic is an imposing historical building on the Via Vittorio Veneto. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Trevi fountain and the Spansih Steps. Hop on hop off open deck tour buses stop very close to the hotel. There are many restaurants nearby. Turn left out of the hotel and you will find the Hard Rock Cafe Rome with Harry's Bar slightly further along. Turn right and there are quite a few restaurants with pavement seating (do not go to the restaurant with a yellow sign at the end of the road as the food is terrible, unless you like getting your meal in installements and cold, and highly priced with the most dreadful service - it was called something like Labiata). Interior of the hotel was very 19th Century (in a good way). Service was very efficient although the restaurant staff could do with smiling a bit! The bedroom we were given was small and was a disappointment coupled with the fact that when you opened the window there was no view as we were underground despite being on the first floor (I think the building must be on a hill!). Breakfast is served on a terrace with enjoyable views. If you want any eggs apart from scrambled then you have to pay extra - boiled was 8 euros, fried 10 euros, and omlettes up to 16 euros extra. Minibar in room is not too expensive - for soft drinks anyway. The Majestic is a good base if you are going to Rome to see the sights - try to get a room on the second floor or above if you want a view!

Reviews.Title: “Superb city hotel - stay with confidence!”
Reviews.Author: CazRob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with teenage sons - one twin room and one double. It is a superb city hotel in all respects. For me the little touches mean the most - good quality toiletries, linen, towels etc, high levels of cleanliness and supremely comfortable beds. Good turn down service in the evenings, excellent service throughout the hotel ... most of all take time for a few drinks in the bar - the staff are genuinly interested in you as guests! Book with confidence - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “The Majestic is like being in a Fellini Film”
Reviews.Author: CDGItalia
Reviews.Content: Every moment you spend inside the walls of this stunning hotel you could almost fool yourself into believing that its the Rome of the 1950's and the glitterati of Europe are all enjoying an espresso outside your door. The Majestic is more than just a five star hotel- it is the very definition of Italian style and class. The Hotel itself is breathtaking and the service from all the staff is absolutely flawless. A very special thankyou to the ultimate gentlemen, Faisal, Claudio and of course Lanfranco. You can expect me again next year (for more shopping)-I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Old Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ges757
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Rome, Italy. My husband and good friends traveled there for 4 days prior to a cruise. This hotel fit our needs entirely. The staff were very friendly and helpful. To be greeted with a smile and good morning made us all feel welcomed. We received with our room a breakfast every morning that satisfied all in the group. The wait staff were very attentive. Our room was clean and comfortable. The space was adequate. We were only in our rooms to sleep and shower after all one can hang out while at home for free. The location was close enough to the metro station, decent restaraunts and shopping. We managed to walk away our calories to most attractions. Overall this hotel was quaint and of the highest quality truely a classic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: nearchos
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Majestic for a 5 day visit with my wife and daughter. The hotel was exceptionally clean, all members of staff were very helpful, especially the reception. The hotel has kept it's class of the 19th century. Our room was overlooking via veneto, which was great. Rooms were cleaned twice a day, the hotel corridors, the breakfast area were spotless. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Offers a lot and clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: fattyontour
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled with her sister and husband and we had three nights at the Majestic, the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel has a great breakfast both in food quality and where it is situated> We had two rooms both are finished fine but our bathroom was a joke as it was so small and it was even hard to get into it let alone shower or use the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel, First Class Service, Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: WalesBenson
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four who enjoyed a wonderful three night stay at this hotel. Our rooms were beautiful and the air conditioning worked well which was very welcome as the weather was extremely hot. The staff in all areas of the hotel were exceptionally helpful. When we arrived we were greeted at the reception desk by Faisal and Claudio. They suggested and booked a restaurant for us on our first night. It was only a few doors down from the hotel and the food was the best we have had for some considerable time. Breakfast was included in our tariff and this was enjoyed on the terrace. The service was impeccable and the selection of breakfast food excellent. We had lunch on two occasions at their brasserie called La Ninfa. We sat outside one day and inside on the other. Both occasions were very pleasant with first class food and service. We would highly recommend this hotel and if we visit Rome again we would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A most pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Frans16932
Reviews.Content: Apart from its location and charm, but with all modern amenities, I have found the staff to help in all ways and manners. My wife and I were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversay and the management went out of their way to make our stay as pleasant as possible. We have stayed in many Rome hotels, even in the vicinity, but have found the Majestic to be the best. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jms5353
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic Hotel back in August of 2009 and enjoyed my stay. The Majestic has a lot of old world character. This was my 2nd time in Rome. My first time I stayed at the Hotely FortySeven which I liked as well however the Majestic had a charm of its own. The FortySeven was classical modern while the Majestic was traditional and full of old world charm. My room was a standard garden view but you could tell it was recently updated with new carpeting, a small flat screen tv, and new bedding. Everything was kept spotless from the room to the marble bathroom. If you looked closely you could see the hotel is older with thickly painted walls and lovely wood finishes. My most favorite part of the hotel is the terrace in which they serve breakfast at. It was a lovely place that looked down on the tree lined via veneto. Was a great place to start the day. The breakfast was plenty however it was more so an Italian breakfast and lacked some American favorites. Nevertheless it was enjoyable. I loved being on Via Veneto it was a lovely tree lined street great for strolloing. All and all I would love to come back to the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vittorioza
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several times at Majestic and in all fairness I find it a great hotel to stay in Rome. The rooms are cosy and nicely decorated, the breakfast is great and is served on one of the nicest terraces in Rome if the weather allows, the staff is very nice (not so easy to find in Rome!) and definately helpful. One of my favorites spots!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, old world Grand Hotel but thoroughly modern”
Reviews.Author: Robert49463
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 5 nights and were thrilled with the experience. The room was bright and well furnished with top quality linens and comfortable beds. although we had read about some AC issues, we had none at all, but the weather was cooler than normal, although it seemed to be more than adequate. The staff were exceptional and very interested in helping and we found the dining recommendations to be very reliable. The in house up market restaurant call Filippo La Mantia to be less than stellar and living on its reputation (or rather on that of the chef). The location on the Via Veneto is perfect for walking to many of the city's top attractions. All in all a most memorable experience and highly recommended. Robert

Reviews.Title: “One of our Italian highlights!”
Reviews.Author: Americanwithtaste
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! Great location. Our room was lovely, staff was wonderful and I liked the old elevator. There is something to be said for "classic". Although it was hot while we were there, I don't remember having an issue with the AC. In a word, I would describe our stay as charming.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: jpaScandanavia
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at The Majestic. Our suite was huge with two bathrooms and a beautiful terrace over looking rome. The service was really lovely from everyone at the hotel. Will return as soon as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very charming but like an old LADY”
Reviews.Author: shoptilyoudrop
Reviews.Content: The location is superb and the house is wonderful. If you compare with 5 stars hotel in for ex. the USA you will be disappointed, this hotel is like an old but very, very charming Lady. Staff are extremly helpful and serviceminded. Upgraded to floor 5, suite with a balcony, perfect to sit in the sun and weather is +15 , when you came from cold and snowy Sweden. Sparkling wine for my birthday was really nice. Thank you! Bed a little bit hard, bedclothes very good quality. Breakfast OK, but not 5 star, and notice the price if you ordering something extra from the menu. Rome is overall very expensive. Can´t understand why a glas of ordinary wine must cost 7-8 euro, in a country that produce so much wine, and a simple lunch 50-60 euro! Despite this, Rome is an outstanding, marvellous,and gorgeous city.

Reviews.Title: “Magestic option”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: Generally I'm very delighted that I stayed in this hotel. The rooms are very nice decorated, and have everything to have a delightfull stay. The shower was working good, I was worried about the recomendations I found in the page. What it is true is the AC don't work, it was fine for me because I traveled in cold January, but if I get back to Rome and it's a hot weather season, I absolutelly will think twice about Magestic. The breakfast are good also, the hotel is 10 minutes walk from Fontana de Trevi

Reviews.Title: “No strong feelings”
Reviews.Author: Tipfromme
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting here trying to write a review about this hotel, but find that it is hard because I have no strong feelings. Me and my husband stayed at this hotel in December, and were not dissapointed with our choice. We even got an upgrade and the deluxe room was spacious and nicely decorated! However, neither the hotel in general or the staff made a lasting impression. And actually, if the service had been really good, that could have made all the difference. If you are going, our tips would be to get a room towards the back (the street in front of the hotel is a bit noicy) on floor 4 or higher, and request one of the dark floor rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nuviBlumenau
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn´t bad. Great location, helpful staff, beautiful rooms. But we had some problems with the AC. It was so hot during our stay, and the AC does not work very well. Terrible. The parking price is an absurd. There is just one elevator, and it´s old and slow.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: annagdp
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write reviews, however I was so impressed by this hotel, that I felt compelled to do so. The staff was always available, and more than willing to help. The location is unbeatable, close to all major points of intrest but away from the noisey streets of Rome. The room was true to the picture on the web site, as were the rest of the photos. In fact the pictures don't do it justice, it is a spectacular building. The majestic perfectly combines the granduer of yesteryear with sleek sophistication of today. It's both trendy, and plush, making you feel like royalty. Can't wait to return to the Majestic.

Reviews.Title: “The Shower and the AC are 1 star or less”
Reviews.Author: adbtesh
Reviews.Content: Selected Majestic after recommendation by Conde Nast as a 5 star hotel. However, in the Aug heat the AC in my Deluxe room was not even fan level. The best the front desk would say is that the heat was too much!!! To take a shower you must go to a simulator first or surely cause the bathroom to get all wet including any of your personals. There are much better hotels in Rome for half.

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful in Rome! They gonna try to charge you twice everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Milana009
Reviews.Content: Overall, you must be very careful in Rome: watch your bag, how much you're charged in restaurants, taxi...Everywhere! So for me I can't say this was the best place! Don't get taxi from Termini!!! They gonna charge you about 30Euro! When I saw the charge, I said there were no way for me to pay this for 5 min ride and with a lot of shouting I left the driver 17 Euro. The Hotel is nice, but I can't say this something extraordinary for so high price. I would not say it is really the center of Rome, if you are looking to be really in the heart of most attractions, find smth near Spanish Steps. The breakfast at hotel was horrible!!! I never had such food. And forget about trying smth nice at street restaurants! they gonna bring undone pasta or melting lasagna.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Fitz063
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on part of our honeymoon and were very impressed for a city hotel. Rooms were modern, very clean and white! Breakfast was the highlight while simple yet tasty, the service was great and so relaxing. Staff fab. Stunning location and really good value for money. A must if in Roma!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location, rubbish shower”
Reviews.Author: macysnowstorm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the majestic for 3 nights in August. We found the hotel to be in a nice area and enjoyed eat nearby after all the walking of the day. The hotel is near a tub stop but to be honest we walked everywhere Vatican, coliseum, Spanish steps, Trevi fountain…… and im 3 month pregnant!! The room was really nice, got a good deal via easy jet holidays but the bath room was not great the shower does not really reach far enough over the bath I ended up bending backwards to get my hair under the water and it not a lack of pressure thing it is a shower head fixed in wrong place thing. Breakfast was ok. I did not like the hot food but enjoyed everything else on the roof terrace which was lovely. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends visiting rome. Due to the room sizes and location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: barbara050
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The staff was terrific and surprisingly attentive and friendly for a big city hotel. Last time I stayed in Rome (2 years ago) the hotel we stayed in (cannot remember the name) was very dissapointing. This time I researched carefully and was VERY HAPPY with Hotel Majestic. Breakfast was served outside and was quite good. Great location for the hotel too.Our room and our children's adjoing room was very roomy although our friends room was a bit smaller. Just the luck of the draw I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service & comfort, made Rome the highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: RH_Travellors
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently travelled to Italy and Rome was the first stop. We decided to stay at luxury hotels to make the trip extra special and the Hotel Majestic set the bar so high that the other hotels didn't compare. From arranging for our airport pick-up that made arriving from an overnight flight effortless to taking care of every detail exceptionally well, we couldn't have been more impressed. The rooms were very clean, cool and very quiet. The breakfast buffet that was included with our room was great. Whether we were starting early with a tour of the Vatican Museum (highly recommended) or sleeping late, the breakfast on the terrace was a great way to begin the day. All the hotel staff (front desk, restaurant, consierge and doormen) were very fluent in English which made our stay that much easier. We also found the consierge very helpful. Not only did they know our names after the first introduction, they remembered what they had recommended and were very attentive and interested that things had gone well. The restaurants and tours that the hotel arranged were all high quality and it was obvious the tours and restaurants interacted alot with the hotel as we received outstanding service. I was certainly left with the impression that if things hadn't gone well, there was going to be a follow-up by the hotel. There are lots of restaurants, cafes and bars a close walking distance from the hotel and most major attractions are a short walk and so location was ideal. There was lots to do if you wanted but the hotel is small enough that it is quiet and relaxing when that is what you want as well. We knew we were paying more for this hotel and so our expectations were high but they defininitely exceeded them. We will back and I am recommending this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “dolce vita is alive and living at the majestic!”
Reviews.Author: stenson
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 5 days at the Majestic. From the second we pulled up to the hotel, we were pampered and made to feel special and priveleged. The politeness, eagerness to help was wonderful. The room was spotless and tidied twice a day! Breakfast on the terrace was magical .The bed was luxurious, the shower pressure, and temperature control were perfect. I wanna go back! La Dolce Vita is alive and well on the Via Veneto aat the Majestic!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel - nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: 2008Liz
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Majestic Roma is located on Via Veneto, a reasonable walk to both the Borghese Gallery and the Barberini metro stop. The food establishments that line the Via Veneto are geared towards tourists, so you may want to walk south to find a delicious and well-priced meal. The exterior of the hotel as well as the decor inside connotes a grandeur of time gone by. You definitely feel like you have stepped back a century or two by the look of the sweeping staircase, rods that hold the rugs in place on each step and oversized window treatments that pool on the floor. This hotel also follows the old-fashioned practice of having you drop off and pick up your keys every time you enter and leave the hotel. (I was always curious how these places validate that you are, in fact, who you say you are.) The staff was always civil and pleasant, but our room's furnishings were pretty bizarre. The entire room was a blinding white, except for the blood red curtains. They kept out the light really well in the mornings though. The room was a decent size and we were greeted with a plate of fresh fruit, which was quite welcome. There was a lovely breakfast on the patio included in our reservation. It had the usual coffee, pastries, eggs, bacon, yogurt, juices, etc. I think there are two types of breakfasts you can book, either the continental version or the heartier one. Overall, it was a pleasant stay at the Hotel Majestic Roma, but nothing that knocked your socks off

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTraveller73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Majestic Roma is a good hotel in a pretty good location. I would rate the hotel 4 stars. Pros - some of the front staff/concierges are very helpful and polite - nice and quiet rooms (at least the one I had) - excellent house keeping - good location (I loved jogging in the mornings in the Villa Borghese) - free wlan Cons - poor breakfast (although after having excellent dinners who has room for breakfast!!) - poor gym - some of the staff weren't that accommodating - horrible shower (it was virtually impossibe to adjust proper temperature, it was either hot or cold) Overall I would say good value for money but still Hotel Eden is my favourite in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but old fashioned and drab”
Reviews.Author: Ninja77
Reviews.Content: We read other Tripadvisor reviews and so realised early that in this hotel it was important to stay in the upper (3rd or 4th) floors to escape street noise -- make sure you do this! Via Vittorio can be busy and lost sleep is a lost holiday for some. The hotel itself is well located and in 20 minutes you can walk to most of the key attractions of central Rome. While the service level was acceptable it was nothing spectacular. For example there was no cooling (even April can be warm and stuffy) in the room and when the engineer came up to the room he told us in broken English -- air conditioner not working... Only later were we informed by reception that in Italy by law (apparently) no hotels can have airconditioning until May 15th -- very odd indeed, but who knows, it could be true! The bathroom was pretty, with a good amount of space and white marble everywhere. The terrible Achilles Heel of the hotel is its breakfast -- disastrous. Watery cold scrambled eggs EVERYDAY in a dark bar/restaurant in the basement -- not the best way to start a day! Photographs and autographs on the walls claim that starts like Whitney Houston and Bill Gates have stayed -- you gotta wonder. Overall a pleasant experience minus the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fab - it lives up to its name!”
Reviews.Author: LoveGoodHotels7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in lots of 5* hotels but this is something special. It's not big, brash, flashy; rather, it's elegant, very comfortable, the service is fantastic (no, really fantastic) and I would really recommend it. Great location on Via Veneto and the rooms are really comfortable and with a real air of calm. The restaurant for dinner was lovely but breakfast was only ok (cold scrambled eggs!). The bar was lovely. I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel should be a model for all hotels. guests are made to feel extra special”
Reviews.Author: zopito
Reviews.Content: from the moment you arrive this hotel with its professional staff caters to your every need.the new owners should be very proud of this well run establishment. Special cudo's to Ceasar, Claudio, Fasel and Lorenzo.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive... are you paying for name??”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveller12
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in the Hotel Majestic in March. I got a special rate through the group I was booking with but the published rate is twice that amount. Yes: the hotel is on Via Veneto and Yes: it's one of the oldest and best know hotel in Rome but the for the price, I would have expected the service to be better.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bnbona
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel ...I spent alovely week in alovely city with alovely husbend : ) to be direct and usefull ...it's agood choice in a good price to. The location : in the center. .close to every where ..after all rome is a small city . The hotel : old clasic style in anice way. The room: small but really clean and has alot of mirrors to make it look bigger ! I liked it it's really cozy. The bathroom: alot of mirrors ( which what women want ) ,clean and bright. The breakfast : not bad ! the good piont that it has fresh Squeezed Orange Juice . The stuff : very helpful , smily ,polite ....................................the whole Experience was great .

Reviews.Title: “The Majestic is lovely and great for seeing the famous”
Reviews.Author: ksconz
Reviews.Content: I was there with 9 family memebers and the hotel is described perfectly. An older hotel with "old" Hollywood charm and atmosphere. The morning breakfast is wonderful in presentation and situation. Yes the rooms are a bit worn, but you are staying at a perfectly located hotel. Also lots of famouse people watching in the Hotel. So sit back have a coffee or lemonchello and enjoy it! You are in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time, there will be a third”
Reviews.Author: wickedcold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Hotel Majestic twice, there will be a third, fourth etc. This last experience in Sept. of 2008 was just as nice as the first. Believe it or not the staff remembered the two of us, a year after our first stay!! One of the front desk staff called me by name!! There was one thing that kind of made me feel uneasy...When one of the members of the staff needed to enter the room, during the day, they just put the key in and walked in. We were napping (jetlag) but it made me feel a bit uncomfortable. besides that, the staff was incredible. They were helpful with directions and other needs. They made us feel at home and spoke very good english. The rooms are large compared to most in Europe that we have visited. The beds are comfortable, as are the pillows. The photos (artwork) on the walls of some of the floors are interesting and kept us busy for hours. We ran into Paul Sorvino, an actor, he was also staying at the hotel he did not have any problems with photos. I understand quite a few celebritys stay at the Majestic. It is a perfect location for walking to most tourist sites, the spanish steps, the trevi fountain, piazza novana, the panthanon and the Vatican are all within walking distance. If you walk out the door and take a right then cross the street, there is a church...go into the church and pay (donate) to enter the basement. The most incredible site I have ever seen, art work on the walls and celings...Made with the bones of monks. Strange, but if you are into strange....You got it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneAussie1
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel with really friendly staff and great service. Very central near spanish steps. Nothing to much trouble. Expensive to stay, but worth it

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Gleavey
