Reviews.Content: This was the second stop on our honeymoon, we wanted luxury and that's what we got. The staff were really friendly and helpful (although the same can be said for everyone we encountered in Italy) and stepping into the air conditioned, quiet, ornate hotel was just what we had hoped for. Everything you'd expect from a 5 star hotel, lovely big room, huge bathroom, select mini bar etc. The only complaint with the room was that the shower took an age to run any hot water and the drainage wasn't very good. So by the time the shower was hot you were standing in water up to your ankles, this fault was a surpise as everything else at the hotel was perfect. The breakfasts on the terrace were lovely, warm pastries and tea/coffee served to the table as well as a very plentiful buffet and special items menu. The location is great on Via Veneto, not too far from anything but quiet enough to make a change from the bustling streets not so far away. All in all I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MIxed bag”
Reviews.Author: byrneJersey
Reviews.Content: Arrived here on a hot July day and were initially disappointed as the hotel is relatively unassuming, albeit on a decent street (Via veneto) and at the best end of that street ie closest to all the major sights (except for the Borghese gardens). Booked this hotel through leading hotels of the world and thought was one but discovered it is a Small Luxury Hotel instead. Have to say that we were also stressed by the transfer we had prebooked from the hotel being a complete fiasco as we had specified a vehicle big enough for 4 with 6 suitcases and had asked for a mercedes van. A car arrived which meant we had to split and take a cab as well. However the hotel did apologise profusely and these things do happen.. We are a family of 4 and were pleased to get 2 rooms which genuinely interconnected with one door to the corridor and then a small entrance hall leading into the 2 rooms. Decor was slightly odd, sort of modern look but not stark. Our room had a small Juliet balcony overlooking a cafe below ie no view to speak of. We were on first floor and there is traffic noise. A higher floor would be desirable. Breakfast is served at a very attractive roof terrace and the continental breakfast which was included was very decent (pastries, good capuccino etc). Concierge was very user friendly and gave 2 good restaurant recommendations. The hotel has no pool and, with kids, we would have chosen a hotel with a pool for a summer visit ie to cool down after sight seeing. Overall, a mixed visit. I felt that the hotel is in need of investment and may not warrant inclusion in SLH grouping.

Reviews.Title: “magical majestic”
Reviews.Author: gfc4ever
Reviews.Content: my wife and i have just returned from 4 nights at the majestic and we cant stop singing its praises. on arrival we were met by a porter in top hat and tails and our bags taken to reception where we were told we were being upgraded as it was our 25 wedding anniversary. the room was beutifully appointed and even had a bottle of complimentary champagne. the hotel is situated within walking distance of all the major attractions. having read on this website from some people about small rooms and traffic noise we were slightly concerned but we were very satisfied with our lot. small touches like the bed being turned down and linen mats and slippers beig placed beside your bed ,cards telling you what the weather forecast for the next day all made for the special feeling you get from being in a 5 star hotel. if anyone going to rome reads this do yourself a favour and book this hotel. 5 star comfort all the way

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: rascalblackie
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. It is on Via Veneto, a quieter street, yet a 5-minute walk to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, shopping, etc. Half a block away, you can get the Hop-On, Hop-off bus. Service was excellent. The concierge had prebooked some arrangements for us, and he checked with us to make sure everything went well (it did). We had a Junior Suite, and it was surprisingly big, with a large marble bathroom, king-size bed, and sitting area. It was extremely clean. Continental breakfast was included. On the first floor was a outside patio (next to the dining room) - very attentive service and excellent coffee. A full breakfast was offered at E20 if you wanted it. There are many restaurants with outdoor patios nearby, so lots of selection for meals. It is a fascinating hotel to browse at: the old elevator works well, and the furnishings in the meeting rooms are unique. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardireland
Reviews.Content: Most of the staff were excellent and very responsive. There was an error with the bill upon check out and they sorted it out with fuss. Unfortunately we did not find the concierge very helpful...since we were tourists that was a loss. However if you are a business traveller or you know Rome well....this will not be an issue. Breakfast: This was the highlight of the hotel. Ensure you have this covered in your room rate as this would normally cost you 40-50 euro per head. However it is definitely worth 30 euro. Great outdoor location. Great service, although the main waiter was sometimes moody. Great coffee and very extensive buffet including eggs and bacon. Our stay included one meal at their signature restaurant. It would have been very pricey if we were paying. Oustanding meal and service. Yes the rooms are definitely glossy white modern, so be sure that you are ok with this. Bathrooms were marble rich and had all the charm of a luxury hotel from the 60/70's. We stayed in a mini-suite which I would not normally recommend spending extra money on, as it really only provided storage space for our bags. Location: Yes it is within walking distance of most of the sights. You could walk to ancient rome in about 20 mins. The drawback is that it is clearly in very touristy (wealthy tourist) part of the city. You are subject to the usual tourist trap restaurants and crowds. However if you get a deal you can overcome this and find the less touristy spots. Noise: Be advised that the hotel in right on a busy stretch of Via Veneto. Trafic noise becomes an issue after 9am...so if you want to sleep late, ensure you are on the top floor or in back. We had no ac issues but it was early May and no ac was required.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Majestic!”
Reviews.Author: JackieBLondon
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location and amazingly professional and friendly staff. Our room was beautifully decorated and had a balcony with a good view. It was also very clean. We had a lovely lunch in the Ninfa restaurant on our first day too and the buffet breakfast included a comprehensive selection of food and drink. Only one tiny bit of advice. Ask them to turn up the air conditioning. I couldn't make it work and it got slightly stuffy in the night but because of traffice noise opening the balcony doors was not really an option. We would definitely return, however. Many thanks, Majestic, for contributing to a great holiday. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jesslca321
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Majestic for 3 nights and would defintely go back. The location is great! The hotel is right next to the subway station which can get you anywhere in the city. There are tons of resturants right outside the hotel as well. The rooms are nice and we had no problems. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff at the Majestic!”
Reviews.Author: VMSLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 5 days at the Majestic and had a wonderful time! It started off badly with us expecting a king sized bed and actually having a king sized bed made up of 2 singles pushed together! The front desk staff however handled it well, and we changed rooms. The rooms and bathrooms here are nicely decorated and very clean, but small! However this is a common problem in Rome and probably only resolved if you book a suite! The mini bar and breakfast charges are outrageous ....EUR 8 for a bottle of water!! So buy your own provisions and have breakfast out every day! The concierge and all the staff in this hotel are wonderful, very helpful, good with information, very personal service and for this alone we would recommend it. The hotel is very well situated and we walked to all the attractions from here. Good restaurants are nearby too. My boyfriend was ill on the last day and needed to stay in bed all day, and once again the hotel staff were superb. They extended our room until 4.00pm at no additional charge and were very concerned and caring throughout the process. A great hotel and we would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing and fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Anonymousx
Reviews.Content: I visited the Majestic for a short stay this December (2007) and it was amazing. The staff were so friendly and helpful. We really felt looked after the whole time. The room was beautiful and very spacious. We also visited the hotel's restaurant on the first night we were there and the food was delicious. We had a relaxed very enjoyable meal which was the perfect start to a wonderful weekend at the Majestic in Rome. The hotel was central to all the main sights in Rome and we couldn't have asked for a more perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Andywood
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from a short vacation at the Majestic Hotel. It is a marvellous hotel an ideal base to sample the many and varied delights of Rome. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We stayed for 3 nights, the first being my wifes birthday awaiting for us in the room was a bottle of sparkling wine - a thoughtful touch. The room was a nice size, it was clean and the chambermaid checked every night to make sure everything was OK. The only meal that we took in the hotel was the Italian Breakfast - which was adequate. The only negative was that the bar lacked atmosphere - we were often the only people in there

Reviews.Title: “A first class HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: GALANMAC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of ROME and is a perfect 5*. It is operated by the family owners and is a highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wont stay here again”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravelermass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic for three nights - got there pretty early on a Sunday and they had a room ready for us. It was a really great room but the problem was its location - first floor overlooking the busy street and close to the hotel's main entrance. It was VERY loud. We asked to move to a quieter room possibly in the back and the staff treated us very poorly - they were rude and snobby about the request. They moved us to a TINY room on the second floor in the back - the bathroom door did not open all the way as the toilet was in the way. To get in the room, we had to turn sideways and shimmy in - if we were overweight, we would not have fit! But the room was quiet so we stayed in it. For remainder of stay, the staff was rude and not helpful at all. Hotel was nice but staff was unacceptable and ruined our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Central Rome”
Reviews.Author: AC100
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Leading Small Hotels of the World and when asked why we were going to Rome I advised them it was our 15th Wedding Anniversary. On arrival at the hotel we were taken to our room by the receptionist (first time I have experienced this) and she showed us the room and explained anything we needed. The hotel had arranged for a bottle of Fizz and nibbles to be there on our arrival - a very nice touch. The room itself was smallish but plenty of room and the bathroom was large with a window. The hige bed was very very comfortable and it was changed daily. The decor was high gloss white furniture and white walls with bright red curtains - not the type of room I usually book but everything was spotlessly cleaned and maintained. The mininbar was a proper fridge with room for our own bottles! The staff were very friendly and breakfast was served on a terrace overlooking the Via Veneto. Drinks were very expensive but this is Rome and if you're looking for luxury and attentive service and a brilliant location choose this hotel. We drank at one of the many bars just a few steps from the hotel - not as expensive and good for people watching. You could walk every where from this hotel - we took a taxi to the Vatican but discovered it wasn't as far as it looked on the map and walked back easily. 5 mins walk took you to the top of the Spanish Steps and 10 mins to the Trevi Fountain and a little longer to the Piazza Navone. On the whole a luxurious hotel but the rooms were a little too modern for my taste but very comfortable and an excellent location and a beautiful building.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve in Roma - Hotel Majestic”
Reviews.Author: MeganRiley
Reviews.Content: After vowing never to spend another New Years Eve in the UK (always too many tears, tantrums and terrible evenings!), my boyfriend and I booked a 5 day holiday to Roma. We chose the Majestic hotel due to it's location (towards the top of the city, but not too far to walk to local attractions, restaurants and nightlife), because of the rave reviews I'd read on sites similar to this one and plus their website looked pretty fabulous. Our room was lovely, perfect for just the two of us! Every day, afternoon and evening, the hotel staff made sure our room was kept clean and tidy with fresh towels and when we arrived back from an evening/night out we would find our bed turned down for the night - it's the little touches that make it so special!! Breakfast . . . we only had continental, and if I'm honest I was slightly dissapointed with the limited selection (probably also because I had to walk past the eggs and sausages to get to the food we were allowed!), but I refused to pay the difefrence in cost for the full breakfast - but anyway, the city has so many fabulous restaurants and cafes for lunch and dinner, it didn't make sense to fill up on breakfast. The bar is lovely, but doesn't get busy enough to give it some atmosphere, but nevertheless we enjoyed a G&T before heading out for the evening and were well looked after by the bar staff. Roma as a city is amazing, and I definitely recommend anyone to take a holiday there. I ate some of my favourite meals there - especially at the Hotel Eden - a taste sensation!!! Oh my, still makes me smile thinking about it almost a year on! New Years Eve itself, we watched the fireworks by the Spanish Steps - entertaining, although slightly precarious when locals set off their own fireworks! This year we're off to Lisbon for New Years Eve . . . we're planning on a new city every year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but......”
Reviews.Author: tanbo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice location. I love the Via Veneto for its cafes and ambiance. I will consider another hotel when I visit Rome again. The first room they gave us was nice and quiet. Good size. Bathroom needed a bit of work. When we returned from dinner the A/C was out. It was hot. They sent a man to work on it. He vacumed out the filter and left saying there was nothing he could do. It seemed they had had this problem before. We were ready for bed. So, they moved us to a much larger room after we repacked all of our things. The next room was a stinky smoking room. Everything reaked of smoke, the sheets, towels, everything. Nothing seemed fresh. We had to make do because they had no other rooms and it was late. I slept with a robe over my head and still woke up smelling smoke. I wondered if the room was used as a smoking break room! So, the next morning we talked to them. They said for us to pack our bags, have them ready, and they would move us to our third room. Now, that shouldn't be a problem, but this was our 5th hotel in three weeks. We were tired of all the packing and unpacking. So, when we returned we had another room. Nice actually but next to the service elevator and on the street. It was noisy, very noisy. Hard to take a nap in the afternoon. They tried. They were very nice about our complaints and tried to accomodate. We were being reasonable in our requests for a good, cool, quiet room. One of the problems is that they need to renovate. It is an old hotel and has charm. It's has problems like the shower had only very hot water, no cool. It would run from hot to very hot in intervals.The bathroom was old and faucets rusty. As far as service goes, housekeeping rarely got to our room to clean it before 2:00 or 2:30. We would be returning from a busy morning in Rome and come back to an unmade bed. The bar is nice but a bit stuffy. They did have a nice business center we could use but at times the computers were down. The breakfast was very average. We used a huge amount of Amex points on this hotel and it was truly a disappointment. They were good about making reservations and suggestions but failed to tell us that one of the lunch spots where we had reservations did not allow dress shorts. We walked all the way to Piazza Popolo for lunch to find we couldn't eat there. They made the reservation knowing what we were wearing and were on our way out. There's just something missing at this hotel. Its a shame because it could be really nice.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay at the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Psip
Reviews.Content: Over the past few months I have had the opportunity to travel regularly to Rome due to work and so have had the opportunity to stay in a number of Hotels near Via Veneto. My favourite is the Majestic. I love the decor., the service, the cleanliness, the bed linen, the white marble bathrooms, the friendly staff and the excellent breakfast. Once or twice I have been placed in a single room at the back of the hotel and although nice they do not have the space and grandeur of some of the larger rooms at the front of the hotel. Breakfast is my favourite time. You are looked after very well and all the food on offer is excellent. This is very much the type of old style Boutique hotel that I like. The bold & opulent decor. will not be to everyones taste but the rest should not disappoint. It is expensive but if I were paying myself I would decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RetroGuitarBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic in February for 4 nights for a work conference and had a very pleasant stay. I'm not sure what staff that the previous reviewer encountered but I found all staff here to be efficient and friendly, in particular the senior person on the desk who was very friendly, always had a smile and always willing to help with any problems we had. On the first night myself and some colleagues arrived in late (too late to use the restaurant) but the staff at the bar were all too happy to provide bar food even though they had officially closed the kitchen. The room was superb - very clean (spotless to be precise), spacious with an excellent bathroom. I cannot comment on the restaurant food as we did not dine at the main restaurant, although the food provided for lunch was above the usual standard of corporate catering. The hotel is not first class for facilities and does not have a pool (which is a shame), but overall has a feeling of class about it. The conference rooms are a little threadbare but it sort of adds to the hotel's charm. I would say that it does trade off of it's past of having many famous guests (the hotel bar is scattered with notes from celebs saying how much they enjoyed their stay...). I also can't understand how the previous reviewer can say that it is effectively in the middle of nowhere - sure it isn't right next to the coloseum, but it's only a 5-10 minute walk from most attractions including the shopping areas. Plus taxi's aren't that expensive in Rome (about the only thing that isn't though!). For me walking around Rome is not a chore - it's a beautiful city; I guess it depends on whether you are lazy or not... The only grumble I really have is that the breakfast was way below par. I would not have paid for breakfast had I been paying for the hotel myself. In a subject not directly related to the hotel, inexperienced visitors to Rome need to be very, VERY, careful about getting ripped off. Rome is a beautiful place but a big tourist trap and you need to be very streetwise, particularly with bars and restaurants in the area - check every single item on your bill and expect to stand your ground when additional items find their way on to your bill...

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: reviewking123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on trip advisor... First of all, terrible location... there is nothing close to it. The concierge acts as though they are helpful but the look on their face says it all. They think you are stupid for not knowing how to get around in a city you have never been to. Now to the hotel itself - rundown and not taken care of. Finally - the food. We were charged 80 euro (over $100 USD) for breakfast for two. I promise the food was not even edible and we were disgusted. Stay anywhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tonbrother
Reviews.Content: Would Highly recommend this hotel ... Staff was incredible .. made us feel welcome at all times ... left a bottle of complimentary champagne with light snacks and little American flags in our room on July 4th ... nice touch !! Came to room one morning to make sure we were awake for our very early wake up call when our phone was showing busy after having been knocked off the hook sometime in the night. Very nicely appointed rooms .... very clean throughout ... I would give them 5 stars across the board ... hotel is located on the beautiful tree lined Via Venuto strategically located to just about everything ... easy walking distance to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, great shopping etc etc ...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for luxury lovers”
Reviews.Author: fussbudget
Reviews.Content: wonderful service, great location. a classic European hotel. The decor is currently being renovated (which is nice but really not necessary). Not for lovers of sterile modern chic. Only complaint: European shower tho they do offer a jacuzzi tub. Very expensive? Of course.

Reviews.Title: “Real Class and quality service”
Reviews.Author: Gford1948
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, with real class and quality service. My husband and I stayed at the Majestic for three nights booking in 3rd May 2007, and from the first sight of the hotel to the last we were impressed all the way, Our room was at the front and overlooked the Via Veneto, I agree with other reviews that the rooms are not large but neither are they tiny, they are very quaint but most importantly they are spotless and smart. The bed was very comfortable and it had beautiful white crisp quality bedding and there were lovely bathroom accessories which were replaced every day. We were pleasantly suprised when we were also greeted with a complimentary bottle of champagne, a lovely touch as it was my husband’s birthday. We ate in the hotel on the first night in the restaurant on the ground floor, the food was fantastic and again the staff and service was excellent, five star plus if you ask me! I would not hesitate to recommend this to all family and friends, the hotel is immaculate, the staff are very helpful and friendly and the location is just perfect. The hotel is worth every penny, it is really worth saving up that bit extra and staying here. Thank you to all the staff at the Majestic for making our stay so special in particular to Cloudio and Faisal for exceeding all our expectations

Reviews.Title: “Personal service and elegance”
Reviews.Author: Tessere
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this fine hotel was beyond expectations. I have stayed at just about every hotel on the Via Veneto, except for the Excelsior, and can only rave about our accommodations and the level of service. This was a family trip for five; three of stayed at The Majestic;one in a suite, the others in a twin. The suite was lavish, with one and one-half baths, an enormous private terrace. The twin was very spacious, luxuriant of carpeting, drapery, three enormous windows,gorgeous view, crown mouldings, fifteen foot ceilings, an ENORMOUS bathroom, ,jacuzzi, marbled and mirrored. Our bedding was changed every day, the finest of linen and comfort; a breakfast buffet of elegance, enormous variety and perfect service. Our concierge and receptionists, primarily Claudio and Faisal, responded to any concern or wish..even to "topping up" our cell phone. Their restaurant recommendations were flawless. We left some items in our rooms upon our departure for Naples; they were catalogued and sealed in envelopes awaiting our claim. This hotel personifies European service and dignity, elegance and class. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but bring lots of money.”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: If you are used to staying at no surprise hotels such as the Hiltons, the Sheratons, or Holiday Inns, then you will either find the Majestic Roma a refreshing change or annoying in its quirkiness. The location is certainly central to all the usual attractions though in a classier area on the Via Veneto. The hotel itself is very unique and European elegant. In the US, this would be considered a boutique hotel. If you check the hotel's website you will find the rates very expensive, though I found a much more reasonable rate on Expedia. I was assigned a single room on the second floor. The room was by far the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in, even compared to New York City. The view was of an alley and stone wall, though it was a particularly elegant stone wall. Day two of my stay I got a call from the reception desk saying I was being assigned a new room due to some mechanical problem in my current room. This situation was well handled by the hotel staff and I ended up in a much larger room with a better view, so no complaints here. The rooms are very elegant and spotless, with fifteen foot ceilings and crown moldings. Beds are comfortable with high quality linens. There is a mini-bar, but the prices as expected were very high, particularly with adjustment for the Euro. I tried room service one night. Service was quick and polished but the 43 Euro mixed grill was not worth the high price. Bathrooms are mostly marble, but beware the showers which are located in large high bathtubs with strangely rounded bottoms. I nearly slipped and fell several times. The public areas of the hotel are also interesting and unique. The narrow hallways are done in a high gloss white paint and lined with black and white photographs neatly displayed according to the year they were taken. Interesting, but kind of strange for a hotel corridor. The staff were very efficient and attentive, if not somewhat stuffy. Overall, I would recommend this property if you can get a good price on the room, though you will probably end up with one of the smallest rooms available. If cost is of no concern, it looks like one of the higher floor suites with a terrace would be ideal. Either way, make sure you have plenty of Euros to spend.

Reviews.Title: “recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireDolly
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give my husband a wonderful experience for his 40th birthday, We weren't disappointed, the hotel was fantastic, the staff multilingual, welcoming and friendly, the rooms were superb and decadent, the location ideal, just up from piazza barberini, the surrounding restaurants and bars excellent, if a little expensive. The whole experience was amazing and we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice In Rome”
Reviews.Author: mbisbing
Reviews.Content: We had two single rooms on the fourth floor for two nights in February 2007. The rooms were small but luxuriously appointed, immaculately clean and serviced twice daily by the cleaning staff. The beds and linens were of high quality. Public areas are grand. Windows are soundproof. Desk and other staff were friendly, multi-lingual and abundant. The location (near where Via Veneto "starts" at the Piazza Barberini) is convenient to everything by foot or by metro. Apart from the usual overpriced breakfast menus that luxury hotels cannot resist, the Majestic is an excellent value and we plan to stay there on future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Majestic”
Reviews.Author: rockyndixie
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege of honeymooning at this majestic hotel. What an experience! We were treated like royalty in our suite with a terrace. Our room was beautiful with gorgeous crown moldings. The bathroom was spotless and included all the amenities of a five-star hotel. Our robes were luxurious. Our bed was turned down every evening with our slippers at the bedside. The elevator was unique and the hotel's architecture was beautiful. The breakfast buffet and resaurant was amazing and the service was exceptional. The piano bar was beatiful and romantic. Everything was perfect, right down to the golden tassle keyfob.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rogerevans
Reviews.Content: Cetainly not a five star hotel. The facilities don't even come close. It's adequate , but more like staying in a collection of up market hostel flats rather than a luxury hotel. Good location, but the place lacks soul and a central focal point, and to be blunt, the lobby is utterly depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Majesty Travesty!”
Reviews.Author: Massimo_C
Reviews.Content: Apart from a great location (lower end of the Via Veneto) and a pretty lobby, the Majestic has little to recommend it. Our room was on the ground floor, facing the road. The noise was so bad I needed earplugs to sleep. Worse than the noise was the bed. It was so worn and uncomfortable I had to jam a pillow under my back to stop rolling into the mattress. The bed was miniscule (a double for 2 people) and incredibly uncomfortable. I expect 5 star hotels to provide at least a queen bed even for one guest, this was hardly bigger than a single! The decor in our room was garish. A badly executed green and white attempt at Versace. Bathroom was fair in size with bland decor. Floor flooded each time we showered. Poor quality soaps etc. We couldn't watch TV to distract us from the room's shortcomings. The hotel 'fixed' the settings not to allow the volume up above a whisper (except a blaring German channel). Staff were hit and miss. One gentleman on the front desk was very helpful and polite. Others were begrudging. No women on the front desk while we were there, not one. The only female staff I spotted were cleaners. We asked for extended check out, due to our late departing flight to no avail. A half hour extension was finally offered, but soon forgotten. 10 minutes into it they called asking when we were leaving. After 15 minutes cleaners knocked once then came inside, expecting us gone. At check out my husband queried the bill (did the rate originally quoted not include tax, the bill seemed higher than the original price). We were told, rudely I thought, that we were on the cheapest rate they offered. 5 stars but no class. Next time, the Westin. Heavenly bed and amazing service here I come.

Reviews.Title: “Will miss the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: nnnsss
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Majestic after one of those typically horrific red-eye flights that leave you at your hotels doorstep way to early to get a room and too tired to do anything but collapse. It was 8:30 a.m. Reception was friendly and efficient; we were advised that our room would not be ready until noon. We must have looked pathetically downtrodden because we were offered a room to rest in for a few hours until our own room was ready. I could have kissed them! We were led to a very nice room and immediately sunk into a lovely white bed with a fluffy duvet and linen sheets and promptly fell asleep. We called down at reception at noon and they moved us to our own room (which was larger than the previous room) on the fourth floor. In all my years of travelling, I have never had this offered to me and I am eternally grateful. On our first night, we were brought a lovely fruit plate with silver and china as a welcome gift. The hotel offers these nice little touches that make you feel like you are staying somewhere special. For instance, there is turn down service everynight and the hotel provides a small card with a handwritten summary of the weather forecast for the next day. Via Veneto is a lovely, quiet, tree-lined street, peppered with five-star hotels which have now surpassed the gently fading Majectic. Although it was a little far removed from most of the things you'd want to see (i.e. Vatican City, Colloseum, Piazza Navona) the location does feel like an oasis from a city that can sometimes be a little overwhelming. The subway stop is a few steps away however, and can get you easily, for the cost of 1 euro to most locations, provided that you a prepared to walk a little further. Staff was friendly and courteous to a fault. The bed was a little firm but the linen sheets and comfortable duvet more than made up for it. Our bathroom was quite large, and covered in marble from wall to wall. The shower was excellent. Don't bother with the breakfast at the hotel; there are numerous bars and pizzerias that offer breakfast just outside the door for much less money. The furnishings were a little battered but lovely nonetheless. The Majectic gives the impression that it has seen better times, but still thrives to provide a luxury retreat and old world charm. In short, we loved the Majestic and would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great service/Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AJE/KME
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished a 17 day vacation in Italy and Greece. The last two days were spent in Rome. Our stay at Hotel Majestic was terrific. Not only was the staff very nice but helpful. The taxi cab drivers were on strike making it difficult to get the the airport. The hotel arranged for us to be able to get a private car and driver and have us leave through the kitchen entrance in the back of the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing super fancy for the price”
Reviews.Author: Andyvegas
Reviews.Content: It was just a luxurious bland hotel.We we're upgraded to a deluxe room at no extra cost.Staff extremely efficient and helpful.The bathroom was a big disappointment,full of marble and lotions but really really small.I will stay at this hotel again only if i will get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I arranged a business trip to the Hotel Majestic Roma for a large group. I found the staff to be the most friendly, efficient and helpful that i have ever experienced. The reception staff knew everyone's room numbers by heart (a little spooky! but very helpful when requesting particular things for my guests) and accommodated our every request. The catered lunches were excellent, and they took on board my request for enough vegetarian food (something that is rarely done well in continental Europe) as well as catering for our Celiac sufferer. The one niggle was lack of instant internet access - ie. no wireless or cables - but an engineer was despatched quickly with a lead whenever we needed it. My room (415) was enormous and even had a little terrace - perks of being the organiser?! I completed the questionnaire before I left and mentioned the internet issue, and as soon as I logged in the following day there was a personal email from the general manager (or at least that's what it said) referring to this issue and assuring me that they would look into it. We didn't use the restaurant apart from breakfast or the other amenities so i can't comment on them. The hotel was well located, about 10 mins from the Spanish Steps, and with several cafes and restaurants nearby. This hotel may be pricy, and I was lucky enough not to be paying, but the level of service was outstanding and i would certainly pay the extra to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too little for too much..!!”
Reviews.Author: Spinone
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 5 day trip to Rome to celebrate her 40th birthday. On the way to the hotel from the airport our driver informed us that The Majestic was one of the best hotels in Rome which gave us a reassuring feeling. On arrival the front of house is understated but quite nice and we were welcomed by staff with perfect english who were very pleasant. We were shown to our room (210) on the second floor which is where our disappointment started. The room was small, stuffy and very, very tired. It was nothing like the photo's we had seen on a variety of sites and did not match the decriptions from others on this site. Having seen quotes of full refurbishment with contemporary or art deco styling, we saw none of it really. The styling is a bit odd in the rooms I thought, I have an elderley Aunt who has similar in her conservatory, and I dont find that particularly relaxing either. I went down to the reception and asked very politely for a change of room, it was here that I had my first meeting with a concierge (receptionist was busy)who is best described as 'probably unhappy with his role in life'. I have a feeling he might be the one referred to by a previous reviewer who didnt enjoy his company much either. After he had rolled his eyes and looked down his nose at me for a bit I moved back to the receptionist who was now free. He was very helpful and offered me two other rooms to look at on the fourth floor at the rear of the hotel. The first room was no better than 210 so we moved to 424 which was much larger and in slightly better order, although there were still a few bits that were broken, missing or wonky. I returned to the reception and agreed to take 424 for the duration of our stay. He was very pleased and agreed to only charge me an extra 100 Euros per night for the privelege. After some light negotiation we agreed 50 Euros per night. The beds - I can confirm as with other reviewers that the beds are indeed quite hard and a bit dippy in the middle. The hotel has only one lift which is centrally located just off the lobby area. It is one of those older style ones with the open shaft which is nice to look at but quite noisy, especially at night if your room is next to the shaft, as we were. There are two options for dining in the hotel, there is a restaurant on the second floor which looked nice enough but we didnt try it. (Tie required for gents). On the ground floor is a brasserie / piano bar which was empty on the night we ate there. Service was excellent but again it did not make up for the food which was average. Personally, if I go to a restaurant and can cook better food at home without much fuss then they need to try harder (and I can assure you I am not a great cook). The brasserie has lots and lots of signed photos by the rich and famous who have stayed at the hotel and make for interesting viewing. Sadly, I think those days are gone along with the stars who probably now stay at the Hotel De Russie. Whilst we are on the subject of food - the all day breakfast can be served in your room or in the restaurant. Either way the cost is 45 EUROS per person....!!! Turn right out of the hotel instead and go to the cafe just after the book shop. They do great toasties and for 2 they only charge 4 Euros The best thing about this hotel, and in my view the only real redeeming feature, is the staff. They were polite, courteus, helpful and efficient throughout our stay. Even the concierge I mentioned earlier warmed a bit, well a little bit. Big thumbs up for Claudo in reception who was very friendly and helpful. In summary, this is a nice enough hotel so long as you know what you are getting. What you do not get is 5 star as listed. At best this is a low end 4 star for comfort and style. It is too expensive for the quality offered and I think rides too much on the fact that it is listed with 'The Leading Hotels of the World' Group. Having stayed at others also listed with the group, it is our opinion that The Majestic is certainly not worthy of this accolade.

Reviews.Title: “Majestic is majestic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great. Wonderfull room and very friendly efficient staff. I stayed here for business reasons with my partner and it is a great location to get around Rome is easy with public transportation not far away. If you need a taxi the hotel will get you one within a couple of minutes. Many attractions are within walking distance. Contrary to a lot of people's reviews I really liked the bed and slept very well (which I normally do not in hotels). Do not have breakfast here as it is too expensive but this is not a problem as there are many really nice restaurants that serve all day food with great cost/benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Paying the Price of Admission Gets You a Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: fogman444
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Majestic was overall the nicest hotel of the three that I visited during my trip to Rome and Florence this summer. If you can stomach its high price tag, the Majestic is convienently located in a safe and highly touristy area. The location offers easy access to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and a Metro (subway) Stop. The rooms are a good size by European standards but by no means huge. Bathrooms are well stocked with complimentary toiletries and equiped with bath/shower, toilet and bidet. The bed is rather firm and you will either be fine with it or hate it, I did not have a problem with it. The in-room minibar prices are rediculous, as in most hotels. Overall the rooms are nicely appointed. The top-notch service is what makes the Majestic really shine. I flew in during the early afternoon and arrived at the hotel before check-in time. I knew my room would not be ready, but had bags I needed to drop off. Not only did the staff attend to my bags, but they went out of their way to apologize for not having the room prepared (early), sending a complimentary fruit basket up to my room when I did check-in (about an hour of sightseeing later). The concierge was very helpful throughout my stay, providing sightseeing and dinner ideas and booking me a luxury car and driver for a day, posting a letter to the states, and generally answering all my questions about the city. All the while being very friendly and without a hint of the "holier than thou" attitude which is sometimes found. Overall, I very much enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Majestic and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “All a 5 star hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights over the weekend the new pope was enthroned. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the rooms large and comfortable and the staff extremely friendly & helpful. Not cheap but worth every penny. I received a free bottle of champagne as it was my birthday. Apparently the check everybodys' birthdays on their passports but leave you guessing where the champagne came from. There is no doubt we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a 5 star hotel should be.”
Reviews.Author: PClarke
Reviews.Content: We stayed with two friends at the Hotel Majestic for a 4 night city break booked through Expedia. When the Vatican announced that the Pope's funeral would take place on our first full day in Rome we were rather concerned about service at the hotel and how we would manage to see Rome during this period! Everything, however, was just fine, the hotel rooms had all the facilities a 5 star hotel should have, the staff were helpful and friendly and although Rome was busy we managed to see the sights and even got into the Vatican the day after the funeral. Our package did not include breakfast which was a shame, as the hotel charges quite a lot for this, and so we had a breakfast at a cafe just down the road. Also the hotel, like many European ones, do not provide tea/coffee making facilities in your room so it's wise to take a travel kettle! We would definitely recommend this hotel to people looking for a good room, comfortable beds (maybe we like hard mattresses!) and in a very convenient position for sightseeing. It's within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and many other things. The Metro is minutes away and buses, including the 110 open bus tour, pass the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: wuthering
Reviews.Content: The Majestic deserves its 5* rating! Egyptian cotton sheets. Foot mat at the bedside. Windows that open. Fantastic. I told them it was our anniversary and I wanted to make the trip special...a bottle of champagne on ice was waiting for us in our room. How nice. An attentive staff. They're looking into expanding the choices in the "normal"/included breakfast buffet, but what they did have was always fresh and plentiful. Welcomed our desperate need for morning caffeine with gusto and kept the cups filled. And the concierge set us up at the best Veggie restaurant in Rome (Il Margutta) and got us the little extras there that just made the evening better. Top hotel. Keep an eye out for specials on Expedia--only way for normal people to afford it!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place, would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: minitor
Reviews.Content: A great location, large room and a staff that anticipates your needs while appreciating you business. Everyone at the front desk was very helpful. The hotel seemed very updated and was not in need of paint as a previous review mentioned. I'm not sure that they stayed in the same hotel! The beds were comfortable and seemed to be just like the beds in other 4 or 5 star European Hotels visited on this trip. The hotel is within walking distance of many attractions, restaurants and best of all- it is one half block from the Metro (Red Line)! The Metro is great for getting around- it is easy and once you get the hang of it, you'll appreciate the short walk to and from the hotel. We changed hotels during our stay due to the hotel being sold out for a part of our stay. We changed to the Mariott Roma ( a few blocks away) and immediately appreciated the personal touches of the Majestic staff. We decided to visit Pompeii and the staff of the hotel walked us to a travel agent about 3/4 block away to book train tickets. Talk about service. This is a very good choice and you can't go wrong at the Hotel Majestic Roma.
